quoteFirst: They remained there watching and waiting, listening to the revival of life in the farm around them as the daylight gradually increased. Time went by; five and then six o'clock struck. And at about
quoteLast: Mathieu, on looking into the yard, and there catching sight of Denis, who was to return to Paris by the seven o'clock train, hastened down to tell him to call upon Boutan and beg the doctor to come at once. Then, as soon as his son had started, he rejoined Marianne upstairs, still unwilling to call or warn anybody.
title: Fruitfulness

quoteFirst: You must not assume that Irene gave up a large amount of her time to conversation.  She started work at
quoteTime: twenty to seven in the morning
quoteLast: , and if half-past four in the afternoon found her ready (in her own phrase) to pop upstairs and change, she counted she had scored a victory.  After tea came duties of a more leisurely nature such as ironing, and later still—if luck favoured—a brief opportunity for the study of literature, from which she came in such a dazed, confused state of mind, that for the subsequent twenty minutes she could only give answers that possessed a conspicuous amount of incoherence.
